item.title: Minimal Example
item.description: Minimal Pi4J with JBang example GITHUB PROJECT: github.com/Pi4J/pi4j-jbang > Pi4JMinimalExample.java Intro Before proceeding with this example, make sure that you have a Raspberry Pi prepared to execute Java code with JBang as explained here. The following example is based on the “Minimal example application”, and uses the same wiring with a button and LED. By using JBang we can run this project with a single file without the need of a full Maven or Gradle project, or compiling the Java code.

item.title: Simple Button
item.description: Description The SimpleButton is a template class, that you can use in your own Java-project. The Template Class gives you the option to check the state of the button, and to create simple events if the button is pressed, depressed or while it is being pressed. Layout Simple Button Breadboard Big Button Code A simple example on how to use the Button-Class from the Hardware-Catalog: // Initialize the button component final var button = new SimpleButton(pi4j, PIN.

item.title: LED Button
item.description: Description The LedButton is a template class, that you can use in your own Java-project. You can take any Button with a LED you want to. Like for example the big button bellow in the picture gallery. The Template Class gives you the option to check the state of the button, and to create simple events if the button is pressed or depressed, or the whole time is is being pressed.
